result.execSummary:
The defendant Romero D Ellison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation, including attendance at self-help meetings with signed proof.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week when employed, and 5 meetings per week when not employed, and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Stayed.  CFTS to be applied to conditional time if necessary.

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Not to associate with any drug dealers or users.   Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week when not employed and 5 self-help meetings per week when employed, and provide signed proof of attendance. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Preliminary hearing on January 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
